intro: Mercurialis huetii, commonly known as Huet's mercury, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has a sprawling growth habit with hairy stems and small, oval-shaped leaves. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the arid climate of its native habitat. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and interesting species in botanical studies.
